verses.verse: (1 He describeth the malice of his enemies, the flatterers of Saul, who both secretly and openly sought his destruction, from whom he appealeth to God’s judgment,10 Showing that the just shall rejoice, when they see the punishment of the wicked to the glory of God. ) Is it true? O congregation, speak ye justly? O sons of men judge ye uprightly?
Yea, rather ye imagine mischief in your heart: (Ye are not ashamed to execute that cruelty publicly, which ye have imagined in your hearts.) your hands execute cruelty upon the earth.
The wicked (That is, enemies to the people of God even from their birth.) are strangers from the womb: even from the belly have they erred, and speak lies.

Their poison is even like the poison of a serpent; like the deaf (They pass in malice and subtlety the crafty serpent which could preserve himself by stopping his ear from the enchanter.) adder that stoppeth his ear.
Which heareth not the voice of the enchanter, though he be most expert in charming.
Break their (Take away all occasions and means whereby they hurt.) teeth, O God, in their mouths: break the jaws of the young lions, O Lord.

Let them (Considering God’s divine power, he showeth that God in a moment can destroy their force whereof they brag.) melt like the waters, let them pass away; when he shooteth his arrows, let them be as broken.
Let them consume like a snail that melteth, and like the untimely fruit of a woman, that hath not seen the sun.

(As flesh is taken raw out of the pot before the water seethe: so he desireth God to destroy their enterprises before they bring them to pass.) As raw flesh before your pots feel the fire of thorns: so let them carry them away as with a whirlwind in his wrath.
The righteous shall (With a pure affection.) rejoice when he seeth the vengeance; he shall wash his feet in the (Their punishment and slaughter shall be so great.) blood of the wicked.

And men shall say, (Seeing God governeth all by his providence, he must needs put difference between the godly and the wicked.) Verily there is fruit for the righteous; doubtless there is a God that judgeth in the earth.
